note: Depending on the country and year, inequality data relates to income (measured after taxes and benefits) or to consumption, [per capita](#dod:per-capita). To allow for comparisons between countries and over time, death rates are [age-standardized](#dod:age_standardized).
title: Death rate from cancers vs. income inequality
subtitle: Estimated annual number of deaths from all types of [cancer](#dod:cancer) per 100,000 people. The [Gini coefficient](#dod:gini) measures inequality on a scale from 0 to 1. Higher values indicate higher inequality.
